intro: Epidendrum saxatile, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on rocks or trees. The plant features long, strap-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, violet or white flowers. It has a complex root system adapted for absorbing moisture from the air and substrate. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
